intro: Leptonychia echinocarpa, commonly known as the spiny fruit lily, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny capsules that enclose its seeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. The botanical features of Leptonychia echinocarpa make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
